title: My Pixel 4 stops wireless charging overnight once it reaches 100%.
content:
Hello, 

I leave my phone charging overnight wirelessly (using the 10W Xiaomi wireless charger) just to find the next day that it has less battery than I left it with, one day I even got my phone at 67%.

The thing is, once it reaches 100% he starts discharging, but won't fuel back up. In the battery settings I can see the message "Not charging" after it reaches the full battery. 

That's frustrating since this was one of the main reason why I picked this phone.

Do you know why this happens? Is there any way to fix it?
